## 판결문 요약


931 S.W.2d 69 (1996)
325 Ark. 483
Larry C. DONIHOO, Appellant,
v.
STATE of Arkansas, Appellee.
No. CR 95-1194.
Supreme Court of Arkansas.
September 16, 1996.
*71 Garnet E. Norwood, Texarkana, TX, for appellant.
Sandy Moll, Asst. Attorney General, Little Rock, for appellee.
BROWN, Justice.
Appellant Larry C. Donihoo was convicted of multiple counts of statutory rape and violation of a minor in the first degree and sentenced to 90 years in prison. He appeals, urging that the trial court erred in refusing to sever the counts, in allowing photographs and a videotape of sex acts into evidence, in allowing a state witness to testify about matters which surprised him, and in permitting references to parole eligibility by the State in closing argument. The points on appeal are without merit, and we affirm.
The State presented the following evidence at trial. Christina Ward, the victim, testified that she was born on July 6, 1977, and that Donihoo moved in with her and her mother, Jacque Ward, when Christina was three. She testified that Donihoo acted like a father towards her, but that he made her perform oral sex and have sexual intercourse with him after the family moved to East 48th Street in Texarkana in 1989, when she was about 13. She estimated that this happened sometimes two to three times a week while her mother and brother were at work.
